intro: Calochortus eurycarpus, commonly known as the broad-fruited mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces distinctive, fleshy, broad-fruited capsules that contain the seeds. Calochortus eurycarpus is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
